title: Adventures Of Evan: The Lost Valley of Green Giants

pages.text: Evan loved Saturday mornings. He was sprawled on the living room floor, surrounded by his favorite dinosaur figures. The green Brachiosaurus stood tallest, leading the herd across the carpet canyon. "Just a little further," Evan whispered to them, "the Lost Valley is right over this mountain." He moved the long-necked dinosaur forward, imagining what it would be like to discover a place no one had ever seen before.
pages.illustration_prompt: Keep this exact same boy with the same face, hair, and features. The boy is wearing a dark navy/black zip-up hoodie with a small red logo on the chest, dark navy track pants with white triple stripes down the sides, and dark sneakers. He is an 8-year-old boy, NOT a toddler or baby — he looks school-age and confident. He is lying on his stomach on a colorful rug on a cozy living room floor, propped up on his elbows. He is surrounded by several plastic dinosaur figures, including a green Brachiosaurus that stands tallest. Morning sunlight streams through nearby windows. The room has a warm, lived-in feeling with a couch and bookshelf visible in the background. The boy's face shows happy concentration as he plays with the dinosaurs. Indoor scene — living room floor.

pages.text: Outside the window, the big oak tree in the backyard swayed in the breeze. Evan had climbed it a hundred times, but today something looked different. Between the branches, a flash of green light sparkled for just a moment. Evan sat up. Had he imagined it? The light flickered again, like a signal. He grabbed his dinosaur figures, stuffing them in his pockets, and headed outside. Adventure was calling.
pages.illustration_prompt: Keep this exact same boy with the same face, hair, and features. The boy is wearing a dark navy/black zip-up hoodie with a small red logo on the chest, dark navy track pants with white triple stripes down the sides, and dark sneakers. He is standing inside a cozy living room, looking out through a large window with both hands pressed against the glass. The scene is shot from INSIDE the room showing the boy from behind/side angle. Through the window, a large oak tree is visible in a green backyard, with a mysterious bright green magical shimmer glowing between its branches. The living room is slightly dim with warm lamplight. A few dinosaur figures are stuffed in his hoodie pockets. This is an INTERIOR scene — very different from an outdoor dusk scene.

pages.text: Evan climbed the oak tree quickly, his hands and feet finding familiar holds. Higher and higher he went, past the tire swing branch, past the bird's nest level, to the very top where he'd never been brave enough to go before. That's when he saw it: a glowing green archway carved right into the thick trunk. It pulsed with gentle light, and Evan could feel warm air flowing from it. "This wasn't here yesterday," he breathed.
pages.illustration_prompt: Keep this exact same boy with the same face, hair, and features. The boy is wearing a dark navy/black zip-up hoodie with a small red logo on the chest, dark navy track pants with white triple stripes down the sides, and dark sneakers. The boy is SMALL compared to the tree — the oak tree is VERY LARGE and towers above him. He is climbing high up in the massive oak tree's thick branches. Near the top of the tree, a magical glowing green archway is carved into the wide trunk. The archway has ancient-looking patterns around its edges and pulses with green light. The boy is climbing toward it, one hand gripping a branch, looking up in amazement. The tree trunk is at least 3 feet wide. Dappled sunlight filters through leaves. The ground is visible far below, showing how high he has climbed.

pages.text: Taking a deep breath, Evan stepped through the archway. The world shimmered and spun, but only for a second. When his vision cleared, he gasped. He was standing on a rocky ledge overlooking the most incredible valley he'd ever seen. Massive ferns stretched as tall as buildings. A waterfall thundered in the distance, creating rainbows in its mist. And everywhere—EVERYWHERE—dinosaurs walked, grazed, and called to each other. Real, living dinosaurs! "The Lost Valley," Evan whispered. "It's real."
pages.illustration_prompt: Keep this exact same boy with the same face, hair, and features. The boy is wearing a dark navy/black zip-up hoodie with a small red logo on the chest, dark navy track pants with white triple stripes down the sides, and dark sneakers. He stands on a rocky ledge with his arms outstretched in wonder, overlooking a vast prehistoric valley. Giant ferns tower below, a majestic waterfall cascades in the background with rainbows in the mist. Several dinosaurs are visible in the valley: a Triceratops family grazing, Pteranodons flying overhead, and long-necked sauropods in the distance. Everything is lush and green. The boy's face shows pure joy and amazement.

pages.text: Evan carefully climbed down the rocky slope into the valley, using his climbing skills to find the safest path. As he reached the valley floor, a young Stegosaurus trotted up to him, its plates gleaming bright green in the sunlight. It made a friendly chirping sound and nudged Evan's hand with its nose. "Hey there," Evan laughed, pulling out his green Brachiosaurus figure. "Want to meet my friend?" The Stegosaurus sniffed the toy curiously, then nodded as if approving.
pages.illustration_prompt: Evan kneels on soft moss-covered ground, holding out his small green Brachiosaurus toy to a young, friendly Stegosaurus. The Stegosaurus has bright green plates along its back and is sniffing the toy with curiosity. Both Evan and the dinosaur look happy and comfortable with each other. Giant ferns create a natural canopy around them, filtering green-tinted sunlight. The scene feels like the beginning of a friendship. Children's storybook illustration style, warm colors, whimsical, safe and inviting atmosphere.

pages.text: The young Stegosaurus—Evan decided to call her Jade because of her beautiful green plates—led him deeper into the valley. They passed a family of Triceratops munching on ferns and a group of Parasaurolophus drinking from a crystal-clear stream. Everything was peaceful and amazing. But then Jade stopped suddenly, her tail drooping. She pointed with her nose toward the far end of the valley, where the biggest tree Evan had ever seen stood alone. Its leaves were turning brown.
pages.illustration_prompt: Keep this exact same boy with the same face, hair, and features. The boy is wearing a dark navy/black zip-up hoodie with a small red logo on the chest, dark navy track pants with white triple stripes down the sides, and dark sneakers. He walks along a dirt path beside a young friendly Stegosaurus with bright green plates along its back. In the background, friendly Triceratops and Parasaurolophus dinosaurs go about peaceful activities. In the far distance, an enormous ancient tree stands alone with its leaves visibly brown and wilting while everything else is lush green. The Stegosaurus looks worried with her head lowered. The boy follows her gaze with concern on his face, looking toward the dying tree. Both eyes looking naturally in the same direction. The boy MUST be clearly visible and prominent in the scene.

pages.text: As they got closer, Evan understood the problem. The Great Tree—which all the dinosaurs clearly depended on—was sick because its roots were tangled in fallen rocks from a recent rockslide. Water couldn't reach them. "The dinosaurs can't move these rocks," Evan realized, "they don't have hands like we do." He examined the pile carefully. The rocks weren't enormous, but they were wedged tight. This would take clever thinking and careful climbing to solve safely.
pages.illustration_prompt: Keep this exact same boy with the same face, hair, and features. The boy is wearing a dark navy/black zip-up hoodie with a small red logo on the chest, dark navy track pants with white triple stripes down the sides, and dark sneakers. He stands at the base of an enormous ancient tree with brown, wilting leaves. The tree's thick roots are trapped under a pile of medium-sized rocks and boulders. A small stream flows nearby but is blocked from reaching the roots. A young friendly green-plated Stegosaurus stands beside the boy, looking at him hopefully. The boy has his hands on his hips, studying the problem with a determined expression. Afternoon sunlight filters through the canopy. The boy MUST be clearly visible wearing the dark navy/black hoodie and dark track pants with white stripes.

pages.text: Evan started with the smallest rocks, carefully pulling them free and rolling them away. Jade helped by using her tail to push rocks in the direction Evan pointed. "Teamwork!" Evan encouraged her. He climbed up the rock pile, testing each stone before trusting his weight to it. Some were loose and dangerous—those he avoided. Others were key stones that, when removed, made the whole pile shift. Slowly, carefully, working together, they freed the tree's roots one rock at a time.
pages.illustration_prompt: Keep this exact same boy with the same face, hair, and features. The boy is wearing a dark navy/black zip-up hoodie with a small red logo on the chest, dark navy track pants with white triple stripes down the sides, and dark sneakers. He is perched on a pile of natural rocks and boulders near the base of an enormous ancient tree. He is pulling a large rock with both hands to move it aside, while a young green-plated Stegosaurus uses her powerful tail to push another boulder away. A natural forest stream is visible nearby — the rocks had been blocking it from reaching the tree roots. NO pipes, NO spigots, NO man-made objects — only natural rocks, stream water, moss, and prehistoric forest. Some rocks are already cleared and water is beginning to trickle through to the roots. The boy is slightly dusty. The boy MUST be clearly visible wearing the dark navy/black hoodie.

pages.text: With a final heave, Evan and Jade rolled the last big boulder aside. The stream rushed forward, sparkling in the sunlight, flowing around the Great Tree's roots. For a moment, nothing happened. Then—a shimmer ran through the tree's trunk. Its branches straightened. Its leaves began to glow, shifting from brown to brilliant, vibrant green. The whole valley seemed to brighten. All the dinosaurs lifted their heads and called out in celebration. Evan felt his heart soar. He'd done it!

The boy is wearing a dark navy/black zip-up hoodie with a small red logo on the chest, dark navy track pants with white triple stripes down the sides, and dark sneakers. He stands before a massive ancient tree whose leaves are transforming from brown to brilliant glowing green. The boy raises both arms high in triumph with a huge joyful smile. Beside him, a friendly green-plated Stegosaurus rears up in celebration. Sparkling water flows around the tree roots. In the background, Pteranodons soar and other dinosaurs gather to celebrate. The valley is lush and bright with golden sunlight. The boy MUST be clearly visible in the center of the scene, wearing the dark navy/black hoodie and dark track pants with white stripes.

pages.text: The oldest dinosaur in the valley, a wise Brachiosaurus with kind eyes, lowered her long neck down to Evan's level. She made a deep, gentle rumbling sound that Evan somehow understood meant "thank you." She touched her nose to Evan's hand, and in that moment, Evan felt something special—a connection to this ancient world and all its creatures. Jade nuzzled against him, and Evan wrapped his arms around her neck. "I'll remember you," he promised.
pages.illustration_prompt: Keep this exact same boy with the same face, hair, and features. The boy is wearing a dark navy/black zip-up hoodie with a small red logo on the chest, dark navy track pants with white triple stripes down the sides, and dark sneakers. A touching scene: the boy stands between a giant gentle Brachiosaurus whose long neck curves down to his level, and a young green-plated Stegosaurus. The ancient Brachiosaurus has wise, kind eyes and is gently touching the boy's outstretched hand with her nose. The boy is hugging the Stegosaurus's neck with his other arm, eyes closed in a moment of connection. The Great Tree stands tall and healthy behind them, its leaves brilliantly green. Golden afternoon light makes the scene glow with warmth.

pages.text: Jade led Evan back to the rocky ledge where he'd first arrived. The green archway glowed, ready to take him home. Evan turned one last time to look at the Lost Valley—now saved, thriving, and green as far as he could see. He waved to all his new friends, and they called back to him. Stepping through the archway, Evan felt the familiar shimmer. When he opened his eyes, he was at the top of the oak tree in his own backyard.

He stands at a glowing green archway on a rocky ledge, waving goodbye to a valley below. A young green-plated Stegosaurus and many other dinosaurs are gathered, waving back or calling out. The valley behind them is lush, green, and healthy, with a Great Tree standing tall in the distance. The boy has a bittersweet smile, happy but sad to leave. The sun is beginning to set, casting golden light across the prehistoric scene.

pages.text: Evan climbed down from the oak tree just as the porch light flicked on. When he pulled his green Brachiosaurus figure from his pocket, something was different. Its plastic had a slight shimmer now, like it held a secret. Evan smiled. He knew the Lost Valley was real, and that Jade and all the dinosaurs were there, healthy and happy. He'd helped them. And somehow, he knew this wasn't the end. The oak tree still stood tall, and adventures—real adventures—were waiting. All he had to do was climb.
pages.illustration_prompt: Evan sits at the base of the oak tree in his backyard at dusk, holding his green Brachiosaurus figure up to catch the last rays of sunlight. The toy has a subtle magical shimmer to it. His house glows warmly in the background with the porch light on, safe and welcoming. Evan has a knowing, confident smile on his face. The oak tree's branches frame the scene above him. A sense of accomplishment and future adventures fills the air. The mood is warm, cozy, and full of possibility. character_bible_update.appearance_notes: Evan is shown as an active 8-year-old with short hair, typically wearing his favorite green t-shirt. He has an expressive face that shows curiosity, determination, and joy. He moves confidently when climbing and exploring.
character_bible_update.personality_shown: Resourceful, brave, kind to animals, thinks before acting, works well in teams, uses his climbing skills to solve problems, forms quick friendships, keeps promises
friends_met: Jade (young Stegosaurus with bright green plates, friendly and helpful)
The Ancient Brachiosaurus (wise elder of the Lost Valley)
character_bible_update.adventure_summary: Evan discovered a magical portal in his backyard oak tree leading to the Lost Valley, a hidden prehistoric world. He befriended Jade, a young Stegosaurus, and used his climbing skills and problem-solving to save the Great Tree by freeing its roots from a rockslide, earning the gratitude of all the valley's dinosaurs.
